Comment: >The executive order Trump is expected to sign allows domestic car manufacturers to be reimbursed for the 25% tariff on auto parts, senior Commerce Department officials told reporters on Tuesday, to a maximum of 3.75% of the value of domestically produced cars, the officials said. That will be phased out over two years.  It looks like they got worried after a number of "car assembler" plants fired workers. So, they're capping the tariffs on parts to a fairly low percentage.
